indications:
Indications 
(From Interferon gamma: British National Formulary)
Interferon gamma
name: INTERFERON GAMMA-1b
cautions:
Cautions seizure disorders (including seizures associated with fever); cardiac
disease (including ischaemia, congestive heart failure, and arrhythmias); monitor before and during
treatment: haematological tests (including full blood count, differential
white cell count, and platelet count), blood chemistry tests (including
renal and liver function tests) and urinalysis; avoid simultaneous administration of foreign proteins including immunological products (risk of exaggerated immune response); interactions: Appendix 1 (interferons)Driving May impair ability to drive
or operate machinery; effects may be enhanced
by alcohol
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting; headache, fatigue, fever; myalgia,
arthralgia; rash, injection-site reactions; rarely confusion and systemic lupus erythematosus; also reported, neutropenia,
thrombocytopenia, and raised liver enzymes
doses:
By subcutaneous injection, 50 micrograms/m2 3 times a week; patients with body surface area of 0.5 m2 or less, 1.5 micrograms/kg 3 times a week; not yet recommended
for children under 6 months with chronic granulomatous disease
pregnancy:
Pregnancy manufacturers recommend avoid unless potential benefit
outweighs risk (toxicity in animal studies); effective
contraception required during treatment—consult product literature
